meanings.sent1: The stag gracefully leaped over the fallen log.
meanings.sent2: I saw a majestic stag in the forest yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The stag made the other animals jealous with his impressive antlers.
meanings.sent4: The stag stood proudly, a symbol of strength and beauty in the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the stag in the clearing took my breath away.

meanings.definition: A man attending a social gathering without a female companion
meanings.sent1: John felt a bit awkward being the only stag at the party.
meanings.sent2: He decided to go stag to the wedding since his date canceled last minute.
meanings.sent3: The stag at the party was the center of attention among the single ladies.
meanings.sent4: Being a stag at the dance made him feel independent and carefree.
meanings.sent5: The stag at the event was the life of the party, charming everyone with his wit.

meanings.definition: To betray or turn in someone to the authorities
meanings.sent1: He chose to stag his partner to avoid a harsher punishment.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe her best friend would stag her to the police.
meanings.sent3: The criminal decided to stag his accomplice to save himself.
meanings.sent4: Stagging on your friends is never a good idea.
meanings.sent5: The witness was hesitant to stag on the suspect, fearing retaliation.
